image.altText: A metal sign on a building saying YOUTH COURT

props.synopsis: A teenager accused of accessing extremist material on electronic devices owned by his school has been granted release on home detention bail and banned from using the internet.

title.children: Teen accused of possessing extremist material granted home detention bail

image.altText: Soumia shields her eyes, smiling looking up at the sun for a story about being sun smart with darker skin

props.synopsis: As Olympians toil under the French sun, it's a little-known fact that one of the very first sunscreens was invented half a world away in Adelaide.

title.children: From a kitchen laboratory to the Paris Olympics, how a graduate's invention helped turn down the heat

image.altText: A black-and-white photo of a runner with his coach.

props.synopsis: When running legend Herb Elliott won gold in 1960, he did so in a time that would have secured him a spot in the final at the Paris Olympics six decades later — and the sporting partnership that helped achieve that remarkable feat is now being celebrated on the silver screen.

title.children: Running uphill through sand, an eccentric visionary helped pave the path to gold

image.altText: A man in a suit smiles while unwrapping a burger

props.synopsis: Only a few weeks ago, many Americans outside Minnesota had never heard of Tim Walz. Now, he might be the country's next vice-president. Here's what to know about him.

title.children: He came up with the Democrats' new favourite insult against Trump. Now Tim Walz is Harris's running mate

image.altText: P8 Poseidon

props.synopsis: The Australian Defence Force has announced that it will join another military drill in the contested waters of the South China Sea, where there have been a series of increasingly dangerous confrontations between China and the Philippines.

title.children: Australia joins defence exercise in contested South China Sea after Philippines deal with China to ease tensions

image.altText: The Israeli Iron Dome air defence system fires to intercept an attack, shown in the night sky with streaks of light.

props.synopsis: Iran and its Lebanon-based proxy Hezbollah have vowed retaliation against Israel after senior Hamas and Hezbollah figures were killed. This is what we know about the weapons they have.

title.children: As tensions in the Middle East escalate, here's what we know about Hezbollah and Iran's weapons

image.altText: A close up of a woman with glasses walking ahead

props.synopsis: Linda Reynolds has accused her former staffer Brittany Higgins and her now-husband David Sharaz of planning a premeditated attack on her character in the lead up to her interview on Channel 10.

title.children: 'I felt like a fool': Linda Reynolds recounts moment she heard Brittany Higgins' tapes for The Project

image.altText: over shoulder of young female artist doing dot painting on a large sculpture of an A

props.synopsis: What began as a way to preserve memories and explore her grief has blossomed into a thriving art career for Ceduna artist Jaylene Ware, joining the ranks of artists from a town known for its distinctive creative scene.

title.children: A confluence of land, sea, and desert country inspires Ceduna's thriving art scene

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference__45ca69940707cdd3e542a6d38cc18b74

props.synopsis: Tuesday's Reserve Bank outcome looks to have curbed Anthony Albanese's scope for a visit to the governor-general before the end of the year.

title.children: Did the RBA just kill Albanese's early election?

image.altText: Australian personnel approach one of the boats at Kuri Bay.

props.synopsis: Farmers in northern Australia say an influx of illegal fishing boats poses a significant biosecurity risk the government is failing to address.

title.children: Farmers question government's commitment to biosecurity after illegal fishing boats caught in northern WA

image.altText: A close up of Yahya Sinwa at a rally among a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: The announcement comes almost a week after Ismail Haniyeh was killed by a blast in Iran.

title.children: Hamas announces Yahya Sinwar as new leader after assassination of Ismail Haniyeh

image.altText: A bottle of penfolds wine being poured.

props.synopsis: Ultra-premium wine collectors have snapped up a new commemorative bottle of Penfolds, but what is driving the hefty high price tags for luxury drops?

title.children: This $18,000 bottle of Australian wine sold out before it was released

image.altText: Arisa Trew smiles during women's park final in the skateboarding program at Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: This was not a gold that was any better than the others Australia has won at the Olympics — but it was a timely reminder of the good that sport can bring.

title.children: In the beaming face of Arisa Trew, Australia is reminded that sport at its heart is a joyful addiction

image.altText: A mother and child read a picture book while lying on a bed

props.synopsis: A Whyalla mother and first-time children's author hopes her book will break down the stigma around disability and help young families accept differences in the people around them.

title.children: Mum's picture book celebrates autistic son who 'climbs mountains' in his sleep

image.altText: Superintendent Tim Partridge walking out of court while dressed in an official uniform.

props.synopsis: A senior commander was almost certain three extremists would flee their property after gunning down two rural police officers.

title.children: 'Who shoots police and just sits and waits?': Specialist commander takes stand at Wieambilla inquest

image.altText: Tim Walz speaks at a podium in front of a large tractor and a US flag.

props.synopsis: Nobody ever even considered the possibility that Kamala Harris's running mate would be anything but white and male. How will Tim Walz ever be quite sure that he clinched the VP nomination on merit?

title.children: Will Tim Walz ever be sure he clinched the nomination on merit, not because of his Y chromosome?

image.altText: A hole shows where the panel was very close to where passengers sat

props.synopsis: Workers from the embattled airplane company told the US transport safety authority a lack of accountability led to safety issues such as those on the Alaska Airlines plane where a cabin door was missing four bolts and blew out mid-flight.

title.children: 'Garbage' safety culture at Boeing to blame for cabin door blowout mid-flight, watchdog hears

image.altText: Small fossil bone in palm of hand.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a 700,000-year-old arm bone fossil and two teeth on the Indonesian island of Flores is shedding light on how the tiny, now-extinct human Homo floresiensis evolved.

title.children: This tiny arm bone fossil sheds light on the early human species known as the 'hobbit'

image.altText: Various people seen in a crowded suburb of Sydney

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns's department secretary says employees who moved as a result of work-from-home arrangements may need to be flexible.

title.children: NSW government workers ordered back into office told they will need to be flexible

image.altText: A doctor holds a stethoscope in two clasped hands

props.synopsis: Doctors over the age of 70 are more likely to receive a complaint, prompting the Australian medical board to propose regular health checks in order for them to continue working.

title.children: Spike in complaints against older doctors prompts call for regular health checks

image.altText: Andre De Grasse, Mijain Lopez and Arisa Trew

props.synopsis: Arisa Trew's gift revelation, a Cuban Greco-Roman wrestling champion's retirement and the coach of a star sprinter being given his marching orders were just a few of the weird, wonderful and heartbreaking moments from the Olympics today that you might've missed. Here are your quick hits from Paris.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: Arisa Trew's bizarre gift for winning gold, Cuban wrestler retires and coach gets booted

image.altText: A man and woman, with their baby in a pram, looking at the ASX stock market boards in Sydney.

props.synopsis: After a lower start, the Australian share market is trading higher following a rebound on Wall Street overnight. Meanwhile, RBA officials have fronted the Senate's cost of living inquiry, a day after it left interest rates on hold. Follow live.

title.children: RBA officials grilled over cost-of-living crisis, Australian shares gain after Wall Street rebound

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Financial markets 'catch-22' could mean further volatility, trader says
RBNZ may cut interest rates before RBA
'Bluey' coins worth $600,000 stolen by warehouse worker, police allege

image.altText: A gold coin with the image of bluey

props.synopsis: NSW Police said that 64,000 of the limited edition, unreleased coins based on characters from television show Bluey were stolen from a warehouse in Western Sydney.

title.children: Man charged with stealing over $600k worth of Bluey 'dollarbucks' under Strike Force Bandit

image.altText: The exterior of the Questacon building, with a poter of a lego figure on the front windows with the text "curiosity''.

props.synopsis: A Comcare investigation found a spark from the globe had ignited the alcohol-based sanitiser — that had been supplied by Questacon — on the child's hands.

title.children: Charge laid after child's hands allegedly catch fire while touching Questacon exhibit

image.altText: women with her head in her hands looking stressed at her computer

props.synopsis: Many women don't realise perimenopause can begin as early as in their 30s, and that symptoms such as depression and "brain fog", can last for 10 to 15 years.

title.children: 'I thought I was way too young': Perimenopause is taking women by surprise

image.altText: Indian PM Narendra Modi speaks from behind a desk at an India-Pacific Forum

props.synopsis: India has been quietly engaging with the island nations of the Pacific for a decade, and those efforts are increasing.

title.children: 'A new reality': India's Pacific push is getting attention

image.altText: Omar El-Sobihy wearing a black blazer and striped tie.

props.synopsis: Omar El-Sobihy, 20, avoided a conviction after pleading guilty to one count of assault after images of him were released by police at a pro-Palestinian rally in October.

title.children: 'Next time you appear before me, you better be a lawyer': Student warned during Opera House rally sentencing

image.altText: Thelma smiles at the camera as she sits in her wheelchair

props.synopsis: With as many as 68 per cent of people in residential aged care malnourished or at risk of malnutrition, Maggie Beer made it her mission to improve the food served in aged care homes

title.children: How a simple toastie helped transform life in a Perth aged care home

image.altText: Three people on a podium with medals, two are biting them.

props.synopsis: Untold amounts of blood, sweat and tears go into getting to the top step of the Olympic podium. So what's the financial pay-off at the end of it all?

title.children: What's a medal win worth? Here's how much some countries are paying their Olympic medallists

image.altText: A man wearing glasses smiles.

props.synopsis: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus will head Bangladesh's interim government after former prime minister Sheikh Hasina stepped down and fled the country amid a mass uprising against her rule.

title.children: A Nobel laureate will head an interim government in Bangladesh after unrest ousted Hasina

image.altText: A man holds his head in his hands

props.synopsis: Brian Goorjian has ended his second stint as the national side's head coach after the Boomers' heartbreaking quarterfinal loss to Serbia.

title.children: 'I walk away feeling proud': Boomers to search for new coach after Olympic quarterfinal exit

image.altText: Jennifer Board smiles as she looks back to the camera while sat on the beach at what appears to be sunset.

props.synopsis: The family of the young aspiring police officer says 'justice has been served' after a jury convicted a driver over her death.

title.children: Man found guilty of manslaughter of young Townsville motorcyclist during 'high-speed' stolen car chase

image.altText: Department of Justice on a building with american flag behind.

props.synopsis: A Pakistani man with alleged ties to Iran has been charged in the United States in connection with a foiled plot to assassinate a US politician or government officials, the Department of Justice says.

title.children: US charges man with alleged ties to Iran in foiled assassination plot

image.altText: Matt Glaetzer

props.synopsis: Matt Glaetzer has had more Olympic Games near misses than anyone and his decade-long quest for a medal is a study in perseverance and Aussie grit.

title.children: 'Geez, I'm glad I stuck it out': Matt Glaetzer finally claims Olympic medal after 12 years of pain

image.altText: A woman wearing a puffer jacket, green beanie and green backpack crouches in front of a smartphone on a tripod outside at night.

props.synopsis: Smartphones are now advanced enough to take photos that were once only possible using bulky cameras. Here's our guide to snapping a stunning shot of the Milky Way.

title.children: This photo of the Milky Way was shot with a phone — and you can do it too
